page.title: 06WILD LIFE ON THE S.DOWNS
page.content: The S.Downs are waterless except for a few tanks of water pumped up to supply grazing cattle. Therefore they are not a good habitat for animals. Wild animals still found on the downs include: fallow deer, roe deer & muntjak (on the increase in recent years), & foxes, rabbits, brown hares, grey squirrels, stoats & weasles. Spiders & grasshoppers are common & yellow ants on steep unploughed slopes Moths & butterflies which are found along the woodland rides on the warm Southern slopes of the downs are:- Speckled yellow, Fern moth, Chalk carpet, Bell-flower pug, Thyme pug, Ruby tiger, Cream spot tiger & Cinnabar. Speckled wood, Tortoise- shell, Peacock, Red & White Admiral, Painted Lady, Clouded Yellow, Silver- washed & Dark green Fritillery, Meadow Brown, Purple emperor & Brimstones.
